newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - EDS falls after warning.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - EDS falls after warning.

text.p: Shares in Electronic Data Systems Corp fell sharply in trading ahead of the opening on Wall Street after the company said it expected its 1997 earnings to fall below previous expectations.
Traders said the stock was at 35, after closing Thursday at 43-3/16.

EDS said on Thursday after the market's close that it expected an erosion of revenues and earnings to deflate 1997 earnings to a range of $1.90 to $2.00 per share. Earlier, the information services provider said it expected to post 1997 earnings of $2.30 to $2.35 a share before any charge.
One trader cited an Informix trade at 8-1/2, another at 8-3/8. The stock closed Thursday at 10-5/16.

Apple Computer Inc gave back some of its recent Other stocks weakening at the opening included PETsMART Inc, which said it expects to report second quarter results below Wall Street expectations. The stock was trading at 8-1/8, down from its close at 11-12/16, traders said.

The company said it expects to report net income, excluding merger and restructuring charges, for its second quarter in a range of $0.02 to $0.04 a share. First Call put the consensus estimate for the quarter at $0.09 a share.
Informix Corp also traded down after reporting a second-quarter loss and saying it will restate its 1996 results.
gains. Traders cited a Wall Street Journal article saying the computer maker's pact this week with Microsoft Corp does litttle to resolve Apple's long-term problems.
One trader cited Apple at 27-3/4, another at 27-7/8. It closed at 29-3/16.
